title: Gross misdemeanor
text: In United States <a href="law">law</a>, a gross misdemeanor is a <a href="crime">crime</a> which is more serious than a regular <a href="misdemeanor">misdemeanor</a>, but is still classified as a minor crime, as opposed to <a href="felony">serious crimes</a>. Such crimes may include <a href="petty%20theft">petty theft</a>, <a href="assault">simple assault</a> or <a href="driving%20under%20the%20influence">driving under the influence of alcohol and/or other drugs</a>. Typically, the maximum <a href="sentence%20%28law%29">sentence</a> is one year in <a href="county%20jail">county jail</a> and/or $5,000 in fines.
